availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Durrett (Christian County, Kentucky, merchant's clerk and merchant.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, merchant's clerk and merchant. Christian County, Kentucky, native. Son of Henry Durrett and Sarah Clarke Durrett. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in 1850. Merchant's Clerk in Christian County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Merchant in Christian County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 453A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkinsville, p. 669.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 18.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Christian County, KY, July1863, p. 13.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 7787.
"John C. Durrett (1840-1932)," Find A Grave, Memorial 88498984, accessed July 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88498984/john-c-durrett.
